ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُزَّمِّلُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: You who are enwrapped in your clothing!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: O YOU ENWRAPPED in the cloak (of Prophethood),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: You, who have wrapped yourself up with a mantle,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: O the One Wrapped in piety! (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: O you who have wrapped up in your garments!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: O thou enwrapped in thy robes,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: O thou wrapped up in thy raiment!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: O you who are wrapped up in your mantle,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: O you wrapped up in your mantle!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: O you wrapped in garments (i.e. Prophet Muhammad SAW)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [73:1] O you enwrapped in your garment!, the Prophet (al-muzzammil is actually al-mutazammil, but the tā’ has been assimilated with the zāy), that is to say, the one who wraps himself up in his clothes when the Revelation [Gabriel] comes to him, in fear of him because of his awe-inspiring presence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning Allah's saying (0 thou wrapped up in your raiment!): '(0 thou wrapped up in your raiment!) He is referring here to Muhammad (pbuh) who wrapped himself up in his raiment in order to pray.
